result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Curtis Leverne Brantley was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In the Wisconsin State Prison System. Credit
for 31 days time served, if revoked.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
On any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant.

Court orders defendant be assigned to the Mental Health Unit.
*9/10/14  probation term commuted to three (3) years.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment. Take all legally prescribed medications.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
Pay fine in the amount of $1,800.00 - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant is not to drive any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes:
First 6 months are to be served as straight time. As to the remaining 3 months, Court allows release privileges for treatment purposes only.
**9/8/2014 good time credit granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Filed, signed Order.
     The defendant's motion or request for release privileges/additional release privileges is DENIED.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release to DRC.
Per Order signed on 9/8/14:  good time credit granted towards conditional time; and Per Order signed on 9/10/2014:  probation term shall be commuted to three (3) years.
Commuting Probation Term; signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. jbs
Letter from DOC seeking review of probationary term.
Granting Request for Good Time Credit; signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for good time credit.

Defendant Curtis Leverne Brantley in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Sarah McNutt for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Sentencing proceeds. No corrections made to sentencing memorandum. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 60 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 30 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 30 MONTHS. Credit given for 31 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 4 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsind Department of Corrections.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 9 MONTHS "condition time".  First 6 months are to be served as straight time.  As to the remaining 3 months, Court allows release privileges for treatment puposes only.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Take all legally prescribed medications.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY FINE in the amount of $1,800.00 - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Defendant is to be assigned to the mental health unit.
* Defendant's driver operating privileges are REVOKED for a period of 30 months.
* Defendant is not to drive any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
* Any vehicle titled in the defenandant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for a period of 24 months.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

Defendant Curtis Leverne Brantley in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Sarah McNutt for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #2 dismissed outright.

Defendant Curtis Leverne Brantley in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Off record - court is in trial.  

Defense request for a plea and sentence date is approved.  Case is adjourned for plea and sentence in Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-30-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant did appear at approximately 3p.m.  Court orders Stayed Bench Warrant WITHDRAWN.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court.  Tyrone St. Junior for Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Attorney is requesting the Court stay a bench warrant until tomorrow afternoon.  State objects and is requesting a warrant to issue.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until tomorrow.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report; filed.

Court ordered turnover to Wisconsin Correctional Services (WCS).  Conditions of signature bond:  Same conditions as the previous $2,500.00 signature bond to apply.  Also, defendant is to cooperate with WCS and Atty. Vincent Guimont.

Defendant Curtis Leverne Brantley in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Curtis Leverne Brantley IN CUSTODY.  Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for an evidentiary hearing today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.
Defendant no longer wishes to contest the doctor's report.
No other challenges to the doctor's report.
Court ACCEPTS the stipulation and finds that the defendant IS COMPETENT to proceed.
Court REINSTATES the proceedings today.
Court addressed bail:  Defense requests that the $2,500.00 signature bond be reinstated.  State objects and requests a cash bail.  Arguments heard.  
COURT'S RULING:  Based upon the defendant's previous compliance with bail, Court GRANTS defense's request and REINSTATES the $2,500.00 signature bond.   Court ordered turnover to Wisconsin Correctional Services (WCS).  Conditions of signature bond:  Same conditions as the previous $2,500.00 signature bond to apply.  Also, defendant is to cooperate with WCS and Atty. Vincent Guimont.
Parties request a preliminary hearing date before Preliminary Court.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 04-01-2014 at 1:30 PM for Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Court.
The $2,500.00 signature bond is amended to a $2,500.00 cash bond.
Court REVOKES bail release today.  Court sets $2,500.00 cash bail.  If posted, Court ordered TURNOVER to Wisconsin Correctional Services (WCS) with same conditions.

Defendant Curtis Leverne Brantley in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Joanne Hardtke for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for return on doctor's report.
The doctor's report concludes that the defendant is competent to proceed.
Defendant wishes to challenge the competency finding.
Statements made.
Court addressed bail:  Court REVOKES bail release today.  Court sets $2,500.00 cash bail.  If posted, Court ordered turnover to Wisconsin Correctional Services (WCS) with same conditions.
Off the record, clerk conferred with Judge Donald to clarify what he meant by "revoke".  Court "administratively" clarified the record for revoke to mean forfeit/amend.
Court schedules this matter for a contested hearing.
Case adjourned to 03-13-2013 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Evidentiary Hearing.
Psychiatrist, Brooke Lundbohm to testify.

  (DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

as to the defendant prepared by psychologist, Brooke Lundbohm; filed.
Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervenion Program Report dated 1/24/14.

Defendant Curtis Leverne Brantley in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Tyrone St. Junior for Catelin A. Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant REFERRED TO WCS for supervision upon leaving court if they are eligible for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug test and portable breathalyzers. IF THEY FAIL TO REPORT TO WCS A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or as in the manner prescribed.

Defendant Curtis Leverne Brantley in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald,  Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 01/14/2014
